conclusion: Critical point conditions involve setting first and second derivatives of pressure with respect to volume to zero.
Van der Waals equation relates pressure, volume, and temperature with constants a and b.
First derivative of pressure with respect to volume is set to zero at the critical point.
Second derivative of pressure with respect to volume is set to zero at the critical point.
Equations derived from setting first and second derivatives to zero are solved.
Simplification of derived equations by dividing one by the other.
Critical volume V_c is related to b by V_c = 3b.
Substitution of V_c = 3b into the simplified equation.
Critical pressure P_c is given by P_c = a / (27 b^2).
Solving for a using the expression for critical pressure.
